results.description: SelectUSA Japan Roadshow 2016 will be held Feb. 1-5, 2016 in Tokyo, Nagoya, Osaka, and Fukuoka. The investment seminar will bring Japanese companies and Economic Development Organizations. The event will also have service providers on site. You are invited to become a sponsor for this event. The seminar are meant to attract about 200 companies who are considering investing in the U.S. or already investing. A full day seminar will be held in Tokyo on 2/1, a half day trade show format in Tokyo on 2/2, and half day seminars in Nagoya (2/3), Osaka (2/4), and Fukuoka (2/5). Each seminar will include content on investment climate in the US, legal issues, business visas, and investment opportunities.

Expo Manufactura is recognized as the leader among Mexico's metalworking and manufacturing events. With renewed growth in the manufacturing sector, EXPO MANUFACTURA will be the meeting place where buyers and builders come together to exchange ideas and conduct business transactions. The exhibition will create the best international business environment where professionals will meet to talk about key industry topics. EXPO MANUFACTURAâ„¢ is the most important international business forum for the processing and manufacturing industry in Mexico, which brings together the most influential community in the manufacturing sector in the heart of the industrialized north of the country. The 2016 show will bring Mexican and international companies together in a single business center. An U. S. Pavilion will provide additional benefits to U. S. participants like driving traffic to our client's booth and more. Participating sectors are: Medical, Appliances, Automotive, Aerospace, Aeronautics and Metalworking.

The World of Concrete (WOC) is the largest annual international trade show for the commercial concrete and masonry construction industries. WOC occupies more than half a million net square feet of exhibit space, more than 1,200 exhibiting companies will present the latest commercial concrete and masonry construction related products, technology and equipment. Show segments include the Producer Center: a dedicated marketplace of materials, equipment, demos and seminars for concrete producers; Material Handling: offering trucks, excavators and more for material delivery, distribution, concrete placement and earth moving; Concrete Surfaces and Decorative Concrete: featuring everything from stamping, staining, and concrete dyes to polishing, molds and stenciling; Concrete Repair and Demolition: housing a display of surface preparation equipment, scarifying, grinding, sawing equipment and other demolition products; World of Masonry: showcasing a full range of products, tools, information and technology for masonry professionals; and Technology for Construction: a premier feature within World of Concrete for construction software â€“ bid and estimating software, project management and financial software and more.

On February 2 at 2:30 pm EST, the U.S. Department of Commerce, Office of Textiles and Apparel, will host a webinar on the textile and apparel chapter of the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) Agreement. The first part of the webinar will cover the TPP textile and apparel Rules of Origin. Part 2 will provide an overview of the TPP Market Access commitments for textile and apparel goods. A separate webinar providing details of the Vietnam Earned Import Allowance Program will be announced at a later date. Both webinars will allow for a question and answer session for webinar participants. For more information, please contact Maria D'Andrea, (202) 482-1550, or Richard Stetson, (202) 482-2582, or by e-mail at otexa@trade.gov.

For established businesses that are currently exporting, or looking to export as a way to grow revenues. Talk to experts about your business and your export financing needs. SBA will then present methods of trade finance, risk mitigation and creative uses of loan proceeds under its export loan guarantee programs. To register, click the "learn more" link above.

Join us for a webinar on business opportunities in Chile. Chile is stable, prosperous, and consistently ranks high on international indices relating to economic freedom, transparency, and competitiveness. Chile continues to be a strong trading partner and export market for U.S. companies, largely due to its open market policies, zero tariffs, stable democratic government, solid business practices, and low corruption. While GDP growth over the last 30 years has averaged 5% per year, the Chilean economy has slowed recently, with just 1.9% growth in 2014 and projected GDP growth of less than 2.0% in 2015. As the United States - Chile Free Trade Agreement (FTA) concludes its eleventh year, trade of products and services continues to be a resounding success, with an increase of over 330% in bilateral trade since implementation. As of January 2015, the FTA is complete and all U.S.-origin products now enter Chile tariff free.

results.event_name: Smart Cities Infrastructure Trade Mission to India
results.description: The United States Department of Commerce, International Trade Administration (ITA), is organizing an Infrastructure Services Trade Mission to India. February 8-12th, 2016. The purpose of the mission is to introduce U.S. firms to India's rapidly expanding infrastructure projects, and to assist U.S. companies in pursuing export opportunities in this sector. The mission is designed for U.S. water sanitation, electrical, and IT infrastructure companies. The mission also will help U.S. companies already doing business in India to increase their footprint and deepen their business interests. Target sectors holding high potential for U.S exporters include, are not limited to: IT architecture, security solutions, Smart Grid applications, Building Energy Management Systems, environmental city planning systems, waste to energy technology, sewage treatment technology, and advanced filtration systems. There will be optional stops in Vizag/Bengaluru. The participation fee for the trade mission to India- New Delhi, Mumbai and Chennai, is $4,000.00 for small or medium-sized enterprises (SME) and $4,500.00 for large firms and trade associations/organizations. The fee for each additional representative is $1000.00. The additional stop to Vizag (optional stop) , requires an additional $100 per firm for an SME, and $300 per firm for Large firm.

On February 16, 2016, the U.S. Commercial Service invites you to participate in a webinar highlighting the opportunities for U.S. education technology firms in the Turkish market. Embassy Commercial Education Technology Specialist Perim Akguner will give a market briefing on the education technology market in Turkey and 2 U.S. education technology firms will discuss their experiences and challenges in the market.

results.event_name: Women's Business Center - SBA Programs and Services
results.description: What does the SBA offers to small business owners? SBA offers a variety of loans programs for very specific purposes. The programs are many and varied, and the qualifications for each are specific. SBA can help guaranty a loan for you with a lender, third party lender, guarantee a bond, or help you find a venture capital. Understanding how SBA works is the first step towards receiving assistance. Whether you are just getting started or you are an existing business looking to expand, at this free workshop you will learn about our programs and how our resource partners: SCORE, SBDC, and WBC can help you with your business training and business planning. Registration is required. Limited seating is available, register today! http://www.wbea-texas.org/about-wbea
